medical_history.chief_complaint: Recurrent fevers with temperatures up to 40.6°C.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: High fevers started approximately 2 months before admission, occurring daily for 5 days, resolving for 4 days, and then recurring for another 4 to 5 days. In the 9 days before admission, fevers recurred at night. After consulting her pediatrician, intermittent fever continued for 4 days despite treatment with ibuprofen and acetaminophen, culminating in an elevated temperature of 40.6°C with irritability 2 days prior to admission.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Pelvic kidney; otherwise, been well until the recent onset of recurrent fevers.
medical_history.family_history: Father with Graves' disease, mother with polycystic ovary syndrome, sister with a urinary tract infection, brother with esophageal atresia and tracheomalacia.
medical_history.social_history: Lives with parents, older siblings, a dog, and two cats; no exposure to tuberculosis or sick contacts; no recent travel outside the country.
